title: Roman Emperor Caligula, known for his eccentricity and sadistic despotism, is assassinated by his disgruntled Praetorian Guards. The Guard then proclaims Caligula's uncle Claudius as Emperor.
text: • AD 41 – Roman Emperor Caligula, known for his eccentricity and sadistic despotism, is assassinated by his disgruntled Praetorian Guards. The Guard then proclaims Caligula's uncle Claudius as Emperor.

title: The Council of Basel suspends Pope Eugene IV.
text: • 1438 – The Council of Basel suspends Pope Eugene IV.

title: Matthias Corvinus becomes king of Hungary.
text: • 1458 – Matthias Corvinus becomes king of Hungary.

title: Afonso Mendes, appointed by Pope Gregory XV as Prelate of Ethiopia, arrives at Massawa from Goa.
text: • 1624 – Afonso Mendes, appointed by Pope Gregory XV as Prelate of Ethiopia, arrives at Massawa from Goa.

title: King Charles II of England dissolves the Cavalier Parliament.
text: • 1679 – King Charles II of England dissolves the Cavalier Parliament.

title: Peshva warrior Chimnaji Appa defeats Portuguese forces and captures Tarapur Fort, India.
text: • 1739 – Peshva warrior Chimnaji Appa defeats Portuguese forces and captures Tarapur Fort, India.

title: Charles VII Albert becomes Holy Roman Emperor.
text: • 1742 – Charles VII Albert becomes Holy Roman Emperor.

title: During the Seven Years' War the leading burghers of Königsberg submit to Elizabeth of Russia, thus forming Russian Prussia (until 1763)
text: • 1758 – During the Seven Years' War the leading burghers of Königsberg submit to Elizabeth of Russia, thus forming Russian Prussia (until 1763)

title: Crossing of the Andes: Many soldiers of Juan Gregorio de las Heras are captured during the Action of Picheuta.
text: • 1817 – Crossing of the Andes: Many soldiers of Juan Gregorio de las Heras are captured during the Action of Picheuta.

title: Slaves in Salvador da Bahia, Brazil, stage a revolt, which is instrumental in ending slavery there 50 years later.
text: • 1835 – Slaves in Salvador da Bahia, Brazil, stage a revolt, which is instrumental in ending slavery there 50 years later.

title: California Gold Rush: James W. Marshall finds gold at Sutter's Mill near Sacramento.
text: • 1848 – California Gold Rush: James W. Marshall finds gold at Sutter's Mill near Sacramento.

title: The University of Calcutta is formally founded as the first fully fledged university in South Asia.
text: • 1857 – The University of Calcutta is formally founded as the first fully fledged university in South Asia.

title: The United Principalities of Moldavia and Wallachia (later named Romania) is formed as a personal union under the rule of Domnitor Alexandru Ioan Cuza.
text: • 1859 – The United Principalities of Moldavia and Wallachia (later named Romania) is formed as a personal union under the rule of Domnitor Alexandru Ioan Cuza.

title: Bucharest is proclaimed the capital of Romania.
text: • 1862 – Bucharest is proclaimed the capital of Romania.

title: Second Boer War: Boers stop a British attempt to break the Siege of Ladysmith in the Battle of Spion Kop.
text: • 1900 – Second Boer War: Boers stop a British attempt to break the Siege of Ladysmith in the Battle of Spion Kop.

title: The first Boy Scout troop is organized in England by Robert Baden
text: • 1908 – The first Boy Scout troop is organized in England by Robert Baden-Powell.

title: World War I: British Grand Fleet battle cruisers under Vice
text: • 1915 – World War I: British Grand Fleet battle cruisers under Vice-Admiral Sir David Beatty engage Rear-Admiral Franz von Hipper's battle cruisers in the Battle of Dogger Bank.

title: In Brushaber v. Union Pacific Railroad Co., the Supreme Court of the United States declares the federal income tax constitutional.
text: • 1916 – In Brushaber v. Union Pacific Railroad Co., the Supreme Court of the United States declares the federal income tax constitutional.

title: The Gregorian calendar is introduced in Russia by decree of the Council of People's Commissars effective February 14(NS)
text: • 1918 – The Gregorian calendar is introduced in Russia by decree of the Council of People's Commissars effective February 14(NS)

title: The 20th Amendment to the United States Constitution is ratified, changing the beginning and end of terms for all elected federal offices.
text: • 1933 – The 20th Amendment to the United States Constitution is ratified, changing the beginning and end of terms for all elected federal offices.

title: The deadliest earthquake in Chilean history strikes Chillán, killing approximately 28,000 people.
text: • 1939 – The deadliest earthquake in Chilean history strikes Chillán, killing approximately 28,000 people.

title: World War II: The Allies bombard Bangkok, leading Thailand, then under Japanese control, to declare war against the United States and United Kingdom.
text: • 1942 – World War II: The Allies bombard Bangkok, leading Thailand, then under Japanese control, to declare war against the United States and United Kingdom.

title: World War II: Franklin D. Roosevelt and Winston Churchill conclude a conference in Casablanca.
text: • 1943 – World War II: Franklin D. Roosevelt and Winston Churchill conclude a conference in Casablanca.

title: The United Nations General Assembly passes its first resolution to establish the United Nations Atomic Energy Commission.
text: • 1946 – The United Nations General Assembly passes its first resolution to establish the United Nations Atomic Energy Commission.

title: Algerian War: Some units of European volunteers in Algiers stage an insurrection known as the "barricades week", during which they seize government buildings and clash with local police.
text: • 1960 – Algerian War: Some units of European volunteers in Algiers stage an insurrection known as the "barricades week", during which they seize government buildings and clash with local police.

title: Goldsboro B
text: • 1961 – Goldsboro B-52 crash: A bomber carrying two H-bombs breaks up in mid-air over North Carolina. The uranium core of one weapon remains lost.

title: Vietnam War: The 1st Australian Task Force launches Operation Coburg against the North Vietnamese Army and Viet Cong during wider fighting around Long Bình and Biên Hòa
text: • 1968 – Vietnam War: The 1st Australian Task Force launches Operation Coburg against the North Vietnamese Army and Viet Cong during wider fighting around Long Bình and Biên Hòa

title: Japanese Sgt. Shoichi Yokoi is found hiding in a Guam jungle, where he had been since the end of World War II.
text: • 1972 – Japanese Sgt. Shoichi Yokoi is found hiding in a Guam jungle, where he had been since the end of World War II.

title: Atocha massacre occurs in Madrid during the Spanish transition to democracy.
text: • 1977 – Atocha massacre occurs in Madrid during the Spanish transition to democracy.

title: Soviet satellite Kosmos 954, with a nuclear reactor on board, burns up in Earth's atmosphere, scattering radioactive debris over Canada's Northwest Territories. Only 1% is recovered.
text: • 1978 – Soviet satellite Kosmos 954, with a nuclear reactor on board, burns up in Earth's atmosphere, scattering radioactive debris over Canada's Northwest Territories. Only 1% is recovered.

title: Apple Computer places the Macintosh personal computer on sale in the United States.
text: • 1984 – Apple Computer places the Macintosh personal computer on sale in the United States.

title: Notorious serial killer Ted Bundy, with over 30 known victims, is executed by the electric chair at the Florida State Prison
text: • 1989 – Notorious serial killer Ted Bundy, with over 30 known victims, is executed by the electric chair at the Florida State Prison

title: Japan launches Hiten, the country's first lunar probe, the first robotic lunar probe since the Soviet Union's Luna 24 in 1976, and the first lunar probe launched by a country other than Soviet Union or the United States.
text: • 1990 – Japan launches Hiten, the country's first lunar probe, the first robotic lunar probe since the Soviet Union's Luna 24 in 1976, and the first lunar probe launched by a country other than Soviet Union or the United States.

title: The United States Department of Homeland Security officially begins operation.
text: • 2003 – The United States Department of Homeland Security officially begins operation.

title: Cyclone Klaus makes landfall near Bordeaux, France, causing 26 deaths as well as extensive disruptions to public transport and power supplies.
text: • 2009 – Cyclone Klaus makes landfall near Bordeaux, France, causing 26 deaths as well as extensive disruptions to public transport and power supplies.

title: At least 35 die and 180 are injured in a bombing at Moscow's Domodedovo Airport.
text: • 2011 – At least 35 die and 180 are injured in a bombing at Moscow's Domodedovo Airport.
